summary: Completed frontend testing for Gestor Pericial app. Frontend UI loads correctly but CORS configuration prevents connection to Railway backend.

critical_bugs.issue: CORS policy blocking requests from localhost:3000 to Railway backend
critical_bugs.impact: Frontend cannot connect to backend - login and all API calls fail
critical_bugs.error_details: Access to XMLHttpRequest at 'https://gestor-pericial-production.up.railway.app/api/health' from origin 'http://localhost:3000' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.

working_endpoints.note: Backend is healthy and responding correctly

integration_issues.issue: Cannot complete login due to CORS blocking API calls
integration_issues.note: UI elements work correctly, issue is backend connectivity

passed_tests: Login page UI renders correctly with proper styling
All form elements (email, password, submit button) are present and functional
Form validation and user interaction works
Backend health endpoint accessible via direct API calls
Backend login endpoint works with valid credentials via direct API calls
Backend properly rejects invalid credentials (401 status)

success_percentage.frontend: 80% (UI works, API integration blocked by CORS)

action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Configure CORS on Railway backend to allow requests from localhost:3000. The backend needs to include 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://localhost:3000' header or configure CORS middleware to allow the frontend origin. All API endpoints are working correctly when accessed directly, but the frontend cannot connect due to CORS policy.
